    • Method Detail

      • characters

        public boolean characters(String characters,
                 boolean closedStartElement)
                   throws SAXException
        Description copied from class: TagListener
        Characters. Always called.
        Specified by:
        characters in class TagListener<TagListenerConfiguration>
        Parameters:
        characters - the characters. May be an empty string.
        closedStartElement - true if the parser closed the start element during parsing. This can happen when your tag listener closes the start element in the characters method or the endElement method. If your implementation closes the start element in the startElement method or your tag listener does not render, then you can safely ignore this method.
        Returns:
        true if you closed the start element, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SAXException - if an error occurs.

      • closeStartElement

        public void closeStartElement()
                       throws SAXException
        Description copied from class: TagListener
        Request by the parser that the tag listener close the start element. This method will not be called if startElement returned true.
        Specified by:
        closeStartElement in class TagListener<TagListenerConfiguration>
        Throws:
        SAXException - if an error occurs.
